Package entity

Class Applicant

  • java.lang.Object
    • entity.User
      • entity.Applicant
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Officer
    public class Applicant
extends User
    The Applicant class represents a user who can apply for BTOs, submit enquiries, and make bookings. It extends the User class, adding application and booking capabilities. This class maintains collections of applications, enquiries, and bookings associated with the applicant, and provides methods to manage these collections.

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Applicant

        public Applicant()
        Default constructor that initializes an Applicant with empty collections for applications, enquiries, and bookings.

      • Applicant

        public Applicant​(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String nric,
                 int age,
                 MarriageStatusEnum maritalStatus,
                 java.lang.String password,
                 Filter filter,
                 java.util.ArrayList<BTOApplication> application,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Enquiry> enquiries,
                 java.util.ArrayList<Booking> booking)
        Parameterized constructor that initializes an Applicant with the specified attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the applicant
        nric - The NRIC (National Registration Identity Card) number of the applicant
        age - The age of the applicant
        maritalStatus - The marital status of the applicant
        password - The password for the applicant's account
        filter - The filter preferences for the applicant
        application - The list of BTO applications submitted by the applicant
        enquiries - The list of enquiries submitted by the applicant
        booking - The list of bookings made by the applicant

      • addToDatabase

        public static boolean addToDatabase​(Applicant applicant)
        Adds an applicant to the applicant database. This static method adds the specified applicant to the database. If the database hasn't been initialized, the method will return false.
        Parameters:
        applicant - The applicant to add to the database
        Returns:
        True if the applicant was successfully added, false otherwise

      • removeFromDatabase

        public static boolean removeFromDatabase​(Applicant applicant)
        Removes an applicant from the applicant database. This static method removes the specified applicant from the database. If the database hasn't been initialized, the method will return false.
        Parameters:
        applicant - The applicant to remove from the database
        Returns:
        True if the applicant was successfully removed, false otherwise

      • getAllApplicants

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Applicant> getAllApplicants()
        Returns all applicants stored in the database.
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing all applicants, or an empty list if the database is not initialized

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this Applicant. The string includes the applicant's name, NRIC, age, marital status, number of applications, and number of enquiries.
        Overrides:
        toString in class User
        Returns:
        A string representation of this Applicant
